Title:
Clavicorona gandariana (Agaricales, Basidiomycota), a new
species from Northwestern Spain
Abstract:
We describe a new species of Clavicorona, C. gandariana,
from Northwestern Spain. In the phylogenetic analyses (ITS+LSU) C.
gandariana appears as sister to the type species of the genus, C.
taxophila. The new species differs from C. taxophila by longer,
ellipsoid to subcylindrical basidiospores, often with a median
constriction; growth on piles of wood and leaves of Salix atrocinerea;
and different ITS and LSU sequences. Our phylogenetic analyses support
the rather isolated position of both species of Clavicorona in relation
to the other phylogenetic lineages in the family Clavariaceae
